intro: Baccharis huydobriana, commonly known as the yellow baccharis, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are opposite and have a rough texture, while its inflorescences are usually terminal and produce small, pale yellow flowers. Baccharis huydobriana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
